name: Elastic monitoring
tagline: Tools to help you monitor your Elastic servers
body:
### Project overview
This project offers free tools that can serve as alternatives to the monitoring tools provided by Elastic. 

1. Analytics Dashboard - A web app that displays your server statistics/details to keep you informed on your server status

![analytics-dashbaord-1](http://i1084.photobucket.com/albums/j413/jwu3725/analytics-dashboard1_zps1gnsf7jt.jpg)
![analytics-dashboard-2](http://i1084.photobucket.com/albums/j413/jwu3725/analytics-dashboard2_zpsaq55trgf.jpg)

2. Slack Alerts - A notification app that alerts you on anomolies in your Elastic servers so you can take action quickly 

![slack-alerts](http://i1084.photobucket.com/albums/j413/jwu3725/slack-alerts_zpsasxzwhra.jpg)

The applications can be customized to monitor Elastic servers for different statistics.

### Authors and Contributors

Teresa Wu(@jwu130)

#### Pre-Requisites:

- [Elastic 2.2 or 2.3](https://www.elastic.co/)
- [Slack account](https://slack.com/)

#### Dependencies

- [Bootstrap 3](http://getbootstrap.com/)
- [Google Chart Tools](https://developers.google.com/chart/)
- Node 4
- http Node Module
- https Node Module
- async Node Module
- [Cluster API 2.3](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/2.3/cluster.html)
- [Slack API](https://api.slack.com/)
